Experience Test Engineer II - Corporate Engineering Google September 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) Mountain View, CA Corporate Engineering is the division tasked with empowering Google employees with world leading technology, from managing data centers to building business applications to providing tech support. My specific role thus far has been to provide test support for Google's payroll and compensation applications through the development of test plans and scenario automation via WebDriver and Protractor. Additionally, I provide a test oriented perspective during the product planning phase, focusing on issues related to both testability (for a more stable release) and usability (for the consumer). Test Engineer II - Android Google July 2011  –  September 2013  (2 years 3 months) Mountain View, CA My work on the Android OS spanned from Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) to Android 4.4 (KitKat). In that time, I primarily focused on testing the media framework, building out existing test automation and infrastructure as well as providing failure investigative support, before shifting to the Google camera application where I brought a similar level of support. From the Nexus 4 onward, I also assisted in camera tuning of all Nexus devices, generating image quality reports qualitatively assessing several metrics (oversharpening, distortion, chromatic aberration, color accuracy, etc.) which helped guide camera tuning decisions. Software Development Engineer in Test Microsoft September 2008  –  July 2011  (2 years 11 months) Redmond, WA During the Office 2010 development cycle, I was the integration test owner for the Natural Language Group. We develop several proofing tools and I worked with our partner teams within Office to ensure their proper and seamless integration. Externally, my responsibilities included driving cross group test efforts to achieve a healthy level of test coverage as well as serving as a primary point of contact for test failures and bug investigations. I worked closely with our partners in Dublin and on occassion managed our contingent staff in Beijing during milestone test passes. Internally, I wrote UI automation libraries and used them to implement most of our application level test cases. I also coordinated manual test passes and helped our linguistic testers implement their end-to-end scenarios. 
 
For the Office15 cycle, I developed an email anonymization tool that allowed us to build up a corpora of sanitized emails which our linguistic components could then train against. I also wrote UI automation libraries for my team as well as automation against Outlook, PowerPoint and OneNote for the new features we added to the Office suite.  Experience Accessibility Test Engineer Google April 2012  – Present (3 years 4 months) Mountain View, CA Project Description: ​ 
Accessibility testing is a type of systems testing designed to determine whether 
individuals with disabilities will be able to use the system which could be software, hardware, or some other type of system. Disabilities encompass a wide range of physical problems, including learning disabilities as well as difficulties with sight, hearing and movement. Google is committed to making accessibility a core consideration from the earliest stages of product design through release. As a part of core accessibility testing team we mandate to monitor the state of accessibility of all Google products and coordinate accessibility training, testing, and consulting to all products teams. ​ 
Google developed its own assistive technologies like Chromevox for Web and Talkback for android to keep the products accessible for all users who uses assistive technologies.  
 
Responsibilities:  
1. Determining the accessibility standards of various Google Applications using assistive 
technologies like Chromevox for web and Talkback for Android on various devices 
2. Determining the accessibility standards of various Google applications on other OS(Mac 
OS, iOS & Windows) using their proprietary assistive technologies like Voiceover and 
JAWS 
3. Design new methodologies to determine accessibility standards of web and mobile 
products 
4. Bug Tracking and Reporting in Bugnizer.  
5. Defect Tracking and Management.  
6. Identify the severity of issues and escalate jeopardy items to appropriate personnel.  Product Support Specialist Google May 2011  –  April 2012  (1 year) Mountain View, CA Project Description: ​ 
Analysis of User feedback reports received through Feedback UI Tool is one of the Google initiative of handling user issues and addressing them in appropriate timelines. This feedback tool brings a level of quick, surface-level interaction with the Google product users that has not been previously possible. Aim of Feedback Verification Team is to address user submitted reports/issues by debugging/reproducing and escalating them to appropriate channels which can be fixed/corrected in upcoming version of respective products 
 
Responsibilities:  
1. Analysis of the User Reports through Feedback UI.  
2. Bug Tracking and Reporting in Issue Tracker.  
3. Reproducing issues based on user reports on various versions of Chrome on different 
Operating Systems.  
 Software Test Engineer Google May 2010  –  May 2011  (1 year 1 month) Hyderabad, India Project Description​: 
Crowd testing is a new and emerging trend in which, rather than relying on a dedicated team of testers with in the company, a crowd test team (created on demand) is used to get complete test coverage and reduce the time to market for their applications. Crowd testing depends on a crowd that is composed out of a large group of diverse people. A crowd should consist out of test experts, users, specialty testers, novices and everybody else that wants to test. A small group of 10 people with the same background gives crowd testing no added value. But they should not only be of various test knowledge, but preferably also from different backgrounds and even different languages. The more different views there are on an application, the more different views that can help get a better product. The scope of testing is the testing of production and sandbox versions of Google applications. End-to-End functionality testing of Google applications is tested.  
 
Responsibilities: 
1. Analysis & Exploratory testing of Google Toolbar 
2. Preparing the Test Plan & Test Scenarios documents.  
3. Bug Tracking and Reporting in Bugzilla and Bugnizer.  
4. Defect Tracking and Management.  Test Engineer Bupa Australia & New Zealand October 2009  –  July 2010  (10 months) Melbourne, Australia Project Description​:

Environment: Windows, Mac, Linux, Bugnizer, TCM. Project Lead MTNL,Mumbai February 2006  –  June 2007  (1 year 5 months) Project: Convergent Billing System for MTNL 
Description: 
 
MTNL is a one of the largest telecom provider in India. MTNL has around six line of Business for which there will be single convergent billing to the subscriber. This configuration fo convergent billing will enable subscriber to get a single invoice or bill for any number of servicers taken from MTNL, unlike earlier each service use to have separate bill ex. If a subscriber has taken GSM and Lese line service from MTNL then, MTNL would generate two separate bills for the subscriber, but this CB will enable the subscriber to pay on a single bill both the charges of the service which he has taken. 
 
Responsibilities: 
Coordinated with business development team and worked as Business Analyst to understand MTNL's requirement. 
As a Business Analyst I was responsible for analyzing the requirements and preparing the system requirement specification.  
Preparing High level document LOB wise. Preparing the low level document for each LOB Preparing , reviewing the various billing documents. Implementing quality related procedures & ensuring compliance to all quality standards. Configuring the product on CB. 
Responsible for overseeing the Quality procedures related to the project. Coordinating in Integration & Implementation at site.
